title-group.article-title: The Maximum Likelihood Estimation of Security Price Volatility: Theory, Evidence, and Application to Option Pricing

abstract.p: Assuming security price dynamics are governed by a diffusion process and given the publicly most available form of data, this paper provides the maximum likelihood estimator of security price volatility. A Monte Carlo simulation compares the small-sample properties of this and other proposed security price volatility estimators. The resultant maximum likelihood estimator of the Black-Scholes call option price formulation is also derived. For small sample sizes a Monte Carlo simulation study facilitates comparison with other proposed estimation procedures. Also, the statistically most powerful confidence intervals for the Black-Scholes call option price are constructed.
